Canonical Class¶

Created on Thu Mar 1 15:43:55 2018

@author: Diego Britez

class Canonical.CanonicalForme(_tshape, dim)[source]¶

Canonical Type Format

In this format, any tensor \(\chi\in V = \otimes_{\mu=1}^{d}V_{\mu}\) a tensor space, is written as the finite sum of rank-1 tensors. \(\chi \in C_{r} (\mathbb{R})\) is said to be represented in the canonical format and it reads,

\(\chi=\sum_{i=1}^{r}{\otimes}_{\mu=1}^{d}x_{u,i}\)

Attributes

_U : list type, in this list will be stored all the modes of the decomposed matrix as an array type each mode ( \(x_{u,i}\)).

_tshape: array like, with the numbers of elements that each 1-rank tensor is going to discretize each subspace of the full tensor.

dim: integer type, number that represent the n-rank tensor that is going to be represented. The value of dim must be coherent with the size of _tshape parameter.

_rank: integer type, this variable is created to store the number of modes of the solution.

Methods

add_enrich(R)[source]¶

add_enrich is the method to add a new mode in each element of the _U list attribute.

get_U()[source]¶

get_U is the methode to call and get the variable _U

get_rank()[source]¶

Method to get _rank value

get_tshape()[source]¶

Method to get _tshape value

set_U(newU)[source]¶

set_U is the methode to call and get _U

set_rank()[source]¶

Method to set a new _rank value

set_tshape(tshape)[source]¶

Method to set a new _tshape value

solution_initialization()[source]¶

This method serve to initiate a new object

writeU()[source]¶

The method writeU create .csv (coma separated values) files with _U list elements ( \(x_{u,i}\)), one file for each mode. The method will print in screen the confirmation that the file was created.
